greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Define f(1) = 0. For n>=2, let f(n) = n - p where p is the largest prime <= n. a(n) = number of iterations of f to reach 0, starting from n.
comment: a(p)=1, a(p+1)=2 and a(p+4)=3 if p is an odd prime but p+2 and p+4 are composite.
Number of noncomposites (A008578) needed to sum to n using the greedy algorithm. - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 09 2015
reference: S. S. Pillai, "An arithmetical function concerning primes", Annamalai University Journal (1930), pp. 159-167.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10007
formula: On Cramér's conjecture, a(n) = O(log* n). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 04 2013
mathematica: f[1]=0; f[n_] := n-Prime[PrimePi[n]]; a[n_] := Module[{k, x}, For[k=0; x=n, x>0, k++; x=f[x], Null]; k]
xref: Cf. A008578, A072492. A066352(n) is the smallest k such that a(k)=n.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 14 2002
